name: places/ChIJ-RwoeRBawokR44vZjJkzz_Y
formattedAddress: 219 Albany St, New York, NY 10280, USA
adrFormatAddress: 219 Albany St, New York, NY 10280, USA

originalText.text:
24 hours is $53.
Close to 18 people with tickets claimed they were being charged $71 on 7/1&7/2.

There's significantly more people experiencing this issue and the supervisor during the morning of 7/2 claimed he was the manager & stated that "that's the price, no questions. Pay or no car"

After speaking to an actual manager and close to 45 mins, the price was adjusted for this issue and the $53 charge was applied.

When attempting to leave, there was a "unpaid charged of $71".

We were told to pay this, AFTER JUST PAYING THE $53.

originalText.text: While the parking attendants are professional, courteous and helpful, the garage itself is poorly run in that there’s no manual way for them to let you exit the facility. I used an app to book and pay for parking. My card was charged, and I received the barcode to gain entrance into the garage. When it came time for me to request my car and leave, I never received an exit barcode. Because of this, the garage would not let me leave. I literally threatened the manager by giving him two choices - one was for me to crash through the gate with my truck, and the other was to call the police to tell them that they were keeping me against my will. When the attendance tried to call the manager, he was anything but helpful. Until Garage figures out how to manually operate the system I will never park there again. I mean what happens if the Internet or power goes out? Are they just going to hold your vehicle hostage? Very bad business practice.

originalText.text:
Made a reservation with ParkMobile. Arrived. Security guard was nice, couldn’t get the QR to scan but said they could help in the garage. Lady in the garage was awesome. Gave parking pass said present this and QR code to pick up. She understood my concern of an $80k vehicle with 2k miles on it.
Returned to get my vehicle and the nightmare began. They told me I had to pay additional fee because what the lady told me wasn’t true. She’s an employee there, why wouldn’t I trust her with her word?  I paid the fee and I wanted my keys as I was parked right at the exit. The attendant told me it would cost $40 ADDITIONAL to drive my own vehicle. To add insult, when he got in, he couldn’t get my vehicle in drive. Then got out and handed MY keys to my significant other as to say I’m a woman and less of a person than him. I would NEVER patronize this business or recommend to anyone. Now I’m fighting ParkMobile for my money back.

originalText.text: One of the best lots I have been to! Staff is friendly and super quick. I get in out and always very quickly which makes this lot really convenient! Make sure to use the Spot Hero app to book the lot. The app is a few dollars cheaper and makes things seamless. All the staff is professional and courteous. The whole team is great, especially Ahmed! Bottom line, if you are headed to the World Trade Center or anywhere in downtown Manhattan this lot is your best choice by far!

originalText.text: Horrible experience! I arrived 4.50pm at the garage address. They did not let me go down and made me go around the whole building. Pedestrian entrance was hard to find. I arrived around 5pm at the parking guys. There were 3 people in front of me. My ticket was until 5.05pm but I scanned it finally at 5.08pm. They wanted $27 extra from me as I scanned 3 min late due to this process. After being on the phone for 30 min with the manager and a horrible customer service experience I gave up. Unbelievable service from this garage….
